author: S.D.
title: Jornada de Bienestar y Salud para la Mujer en Huelva: charlas y ejercicios prÃ¡cticos para fomentar el deporte y los buenos hÃ¡bitos nutricionales y emocionales
text:
Jornada de Bienestar y Salud para la Mujer en Huelva: charlas y ejercicios prÃ¡cticos para fomentar el deporte y los buenos hÃ¡bitos nutricionales y emocionales
Se celebrarÃ¡n en el Centro Municipal La Morana los dÃ­as 29 y 30 de noviembre
Abierto el plazo de inscripciones para la XVI TravesÃ­a Marismas del Odiel
Huelva/Huelva celebrarÃ¡ los dÃ­as 29 y 30 de noviembre en el Centro Municipal La Morana la I Jornada de Bienestar y Salud para la Mujer. Unas jornadas, previs inscripciÃ³n hasta completar aforo, que ofrecen la oportunidad de asistir de manera gratuita a un programa en el que profesionales de distintas disciplinas impartirÃ¡n charlas y ejercicios prÃ¡cticos para reforzar la prevenciÃ³n, fomentando el deporte y los buenos hÃ¡bitos nutricionales y emocionales.
Como explicÃ³ la concejala de Juventud y Deportes del Ayuntamiento de Huelva, MarÃ­a de la O Rubio, â€œademÃ¡s de trabajar en el deporte base, de Ã©lite y federado, nuestro objetivo es fomentar la prÃ¡ctica deportiva, de manera regular y supervisada, como medio para mantener una vida activa, vital y sanaâ€. De esta forma, â€œel objetivo de estas jornadas es resolver dudas sobre la importancia de realizar actividades fÃ­sicas independientemente de la etapa de vida en la que nos encontremos, sobre todo en el caso de las mujeresâ€.
Se trata, por tanto, de un encuentro orientado principalmente a mujeres desde adolescentes, mujeres en edad fÃ©rtil, gestantes, en periodo menopausia y mayores de 60 aÃ±os, aunque como apunta la edil â€œestÃ¡ abierta tambiÃ©n a los hombres, para que conozcan las caracterÃ­sticas especÃ­ficas del deporte en la mujerâ€.
MÃ©dicos, ginecÃ³logas, fisioterapeutas, especialistas en las ciencias de la salud, la actividad fÃ­sica y el deporte, nutricionistas y psicÃ³logos abordarÃ¡n temas de prevenciÃ³n, autocuidados, suelo pÃ©lvico, alimentaciÃ³n, salud Ã³sea, muscular y mental, principalmente enfocados a la mujer y a la importancia del deporte para el bienestar.
La jornada se organiza en dos sesiones, una de tarde el viernes 29 y otra de maÃ±ana, el sÃ¡bado 30 de noviembre, con tres ponencias que incluyen ejercicios prÃ¡cticos cada dÃ­a.
Pilar Gudiel, coordinadora del evento, anunciÃ³ que ya estÃ¡ abierto el plazo para las inscripciones gratuitas. Gudiel asegurÃ³ que â€œse ofrece un abordaje integral para divulgar desde el Ã¡mbito preventivo la importancia de la actividad fÃ­sica en la vida de la mujer, fomentando el autocuidado, la salud y el bienestarâ€.
TambiÃ©n te puede interesar

author: Filomena Fotia
title: Allerta Meteo, allarme dellâ€™Aeronautica Militare: â€œtemporali in 3 regioni tra oggi e domaniâ€
text:
Allerta Meteo per temporali tra oggi e domani, in 3 regioni. Il Servizio Meteorologico dellâ€™Aeronautica Militare ha pubblicato alle 13 di oggi, 13 dicembre 2024 , un nuovo avviso per â€œ fenomeni intensi â€œ. Di seguito il testo integrale.
Allerta Meteo, nuovo avviso dellâ€™Aeronautica Militare â€œ Previsione di fenomeni intensi emessa alle ore 12 UTC del 13/12/24 nella giornata di oggi venerdÃ¬ 13 dicembre 2024:
persistono per le prossime 18/24 ore precipitazioni intense ed abbondanti, a prevalente carattere temporalesco sulla Campania ; si prevedono per le prossime 12/18 ore precipitazioni intense ed abbondanti, a prevalente carattere temporalesco sul Lazio meridionale. Si prevedono inoltre dalla mattinata di domani sabato 14 dicembre 2024, e per le successive 18/24 ore, precipitazioni intense ed abbondanti, a prevalente carattere temporalesco, sulla Basilicata .
I sopracitati fenomeni temporaleschi saranno accompagnati da frequente attivitÃ  elettrica e forti raffiche di vento. Per ulteriori dettagli nello spazio e nel tempo si invita a porre attenzione alle previsioni ordinarie (fxiy68, fxiy69, fxiy70) ed alle successive previsioni di fenomeni intensi (fxiy65) â€œ.
In riferimento allâ€™allerta meteo, va chiarito che le informazioni relative ai fenomeni meteorologici intensi â€“ in base a quanto precisato dal Servizio Meteorologico dellâ€™Aeronautica Militare â€“ si riferiscono esclusivamente alle caratteristiche degli eventi meteo previsti. Tali informazioni sono prive di valutazioni connesse allâ€™impatto sul territorio per le quali si deve far riferimento ai bollettini di allerta meteo relativi al Sistema di Allertamento Nazionale che sono emessi dal Servizio Nazionale di Protezione Civile e sono consultabili alla pagina https://rischi.protezionecivile.gov.it/it/meteo-idro/allertamento
Per monitorare nel modo migliore possibile la situazione meteo in tempo reale, di seguito forniamo un elenco delle pagine con tutte le informazioni utili per seguire il nowcasting meteorologico minuto per minuto:
Di seguito i link per lâ€™accesso diretto alle pagine con le previsioni meteo, particolarmente accurate nei dettagli, per le aree geografiche dâ€™Italia (link sempre raggiungibili anche dal MenÃ¹ in alto in tutte le pagine del sito):
Le Previsioni Meteo Regione per Regione:

author: DOUG SMITH Los Angeles Times
title: $750 a month, no questions asked, improved the lives of homeless people
text: LOS ANGELES â€” If 100 homeless people were given $750 per month for a year, no questions asked, what would they spend it on? That question was at the core of a controlled study conducted by a San Francisco-based nonprofit and the USC Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work. The results were so promising that the researchers decided to publish results after only six months. The answer: food, 36.6%; housing, 19.5%; transportation, 12.7%; clothing, 11.5%; and health care, 6.2%, leaving only 13.6% uncategorized. Those who got the stipend were less likely to be unsheltered after six months and able to meet more of their basic needs than a control group that got no money, and half as likely as the control group to have an episode of being unsheltered. â€œI felt there was enough interest and the initial findings were compelling enough that it was important to get those results out,â€ said Benjamin Henwood, director of the Center for Homelessness, Housing and Health Equity Research at the Dworak-Peck School, who led the study. People are also readingâ€¦ â€œIt may not be earth-shattering that providing money is going to help meet basic needs, but I do think it dispels this myth that people will use money for illicit purposes,â€ Henwood said. â€œWe werenâ€™t finding that in the study.â€ About 2% of the total went to alcohol, cigarettes and drug expenses â€” the largest portion of which was cigarettes, Henwood said. The participants submit monthly reports on their spending and are surveyed in more detail quarterly. A follow-up report will be published after participants have received the funds for a full year. But Henwood said the main findings were robust enough that they were unlikely to change. The study arose from Miracle Messages, a San Francisco-based nonprofit that sends volunteers to the streets and shelters to befriend homeless people and try to make connections with the loved ones who lost contact with them. Next founder and chief executive Kevin F. Adler started Miracle Friends, matching homeless people to volunteer phone buddies for weekly calls. That evolved into Miracle Money when volunteers began asking Adler whether it was OK to give their buddies a few dollars. â€œYou asked me to be a friend to this person, but they donâ€™t know what theyâ€™re going to eat tonight,â€ Adler said they would tell him. Adler didnâ€™t think the volunteers should hand out their own money. But the idea of cash support appealed to him. After a pilot showed promise, Adler got a grant to expand to Los Angeles. He hired two recruiters to canvass homeless shelters. They enlisted more than 200 clients who met the criteria of being at least 18 years old and homeless and expressed interest in having a phone buddy. Rather than just give money away, Adler hoped to document its effect. He teamed up with Henwood, who devised the controlled study. The participants were divided randomly into two groups. One group of 103 received stipends. The others were told they were on a waiting list. After six months, only 12% of those who received funds reported being unsheltered at any time in the prior month, a dramatic decrease from 30% at the outset. Those on the waiting list also reported fewer unsheltered episodes, but by a much smaller margin, from 28% to 23%. The cash recipients also said they were better able to meet their basic needs. On a scale of 1 (completely) to 5 (not at all), they dropped from about 3.75 on average to just over 3.25. The control group did not budge from 3.75. Among those receiving the funds, some found permanent housing, even though the money fell far below average rents in the area, Henwood said. â€œIt seems like itâ€™s opening up possibilities in different ways,â€ he said. â€œThey might have a friend or relative that may not be willing to support them completely, but if they have something to contribute that opens up a room.â€ In other cases, the money created opportunities, even for people who remained unsheltered. â€œI spent a lot of the money on food on the go,â€ one participant told the researchers. â€œSimple, cheap things like bean and cheese burritos. I eat on the run while I bike/work for DoorDash. I also bought a membership to REI, so I could get my bike fixed for free.â€ â€œItâ€™s not a single path forward,â€ Henwood said. â€œItâ€™s a lot of resourcefulness and creativity.â€ 20 facts about homelessness in the US 20 facts about homelessness in the US According to HUD, there were 582,462 people experiencing homelessness in the U.S. in January 2022 The U.S. has seen a 0.3% increase in homelessness since 2020 Conversely, the U.S. has seen an 8.6% decrease in homelessness since 2010 The end of the federal eviction moratorium in August 2021 made millions of Americans' housing situations more precarious during the long tail of the COVID-19 pandemic As of August 2022, one year after the federal eviction moratorium was lifted, nearly 12% of Americans experienced a rent increase of $250 or more per month The marked increase in rental prices during COVID-19 likely contributed to the recent rise in homelessness 40% of all people experiencing homelessness in the U.S. during 2022 were unsheltered Chronic homelessness has increased 15.5% since 2020 Family and youth homelessness have both decreased since 2020 6,398 parenting youth taking care of 7,898 children experienced homelessness in 2022, down 13% since 2020 In 2022, 37% of people experiencing homelessness identified as Black, while only 12% of the overall U.S. population identifies as Black From 2020 to 2022, the number of people who identified as Hispanic or Latino who experienced homelessness rose by 8% The number of people who identify as Hispanic and experienced unsheltered homelessness in 2022 rose 16% since 2020

organizations.name: usc suzanne dworak-peck school of social work
center for homelessness, housing and health equity research

author: @askanews_ita
title: Nato, Meloni: soddisfatta dal vertice, si sono date risposte concrete
text:
Washington, 12 lug. (askanews) â€“ â€œSono soddisfattaâ€ del vertice Nato e delle â€œinterlocuzioni con i colleghiâ€. Lo ha detto la presidente del Consiglio Giorgia Meloni, parlando con i giornalisti a Washington al termine del vertice Nato.
â€œÃˆ stato un vertice molto importante â€“ ha aggiunto â€“ il modo migliore di celebrare il 75esimo anniversario Ã¨ stato allargando il nostro perimetro con la Svezia. Ãˆ molto importante di fronte a uno scenario che sta velocemente mutando: dovevamo dare risposte concrete e sono state dateâ€.
â€œLa Nato non Ã¨ in guerra contro la Russiaâ€ ma â€œnelle dichiarazioni finali ci sono strumenti di sostegno importanti per lâ€™Ucraina, un miglior coordinamento degli aiuti e dellâ€™addestramento. Si conferma che la Nato continuerÃ  a sostenere lâ€™Ucraina per tutto il tempo necessarioâ€ ha dichiarato la premier.

author: @GOMag
title: 5 Queer Directors To Watch Out For - GO Magazine
text: Not all directors get the recognition they deserve. We were reminded of that this year when The Academy snubbed Greta Gerwig for Best Director. But I canâ€™t help but think about the fact that The [Barbie](https://gomag.com/article/11-reasons-the-gay-girls-need-to-see-barbie/) Movie racked up over a billion dollars at the box office. In my opinion, Gerwig did not need that nomination. (The famous Mad Men line â€œthatâ€™s what the moneyâ€™s forâ€ comes to mind.) There are queer directors without an institution like Mattel behind them, working to create gripping and moving images for the big screen. Here are 5 of them to look out for. D. Smith A two time Grammy nominated producer, D. Smith was [blackballed](https://www.sundance.org/blogs/give-me-the-backstory-get-to-know-d-smith-the-filmmaker-behind-kokomo-city/) from the industry when she decided to transition, forcing her to pivot artistically. So she picked up a camera and turned it back on the world. Her directorial debut, Kokomo City is a visually exhilarating documentary about Black trans sex workers in Atlanta and New York City, an exploration of why trans women are overrepresented in this industry. Itâ€™s shot in a stunning high contrast black and white and edited by Smith herself. It is a film filled to the brim with musicality, a poetic and radical truth being told to you casually by a friend. Smith creates a piercing dynamic between four women; Daniella Carter, Koko Da Doll, Liyah Mitchell, and Dominique Silver, by threading the reality of their profession with the reality of their full lives. [Kokomo City](https://www.magpictures.com/kokomocity/watch-at-home/) is streaming and available for purchase. Stewart Thorndike If no one else is, Stewart Thorndike is on the mission of [queering genre films](https://www.rogerebert.com/interviews/stewart-thorndike-bad-things-interview). Her first feature Lyle was a sort of queer Rosemaryâ€™s Baby starring Gaby Hoffman that premiered to praise at Outfest Los Angeles in 2014. In her second film, Bad Things, she turns the messiness of queer love and friendship into a bloody affair when a lesbian couple inherits a haunted hotel. The film premiered at Tribeca in 2023 and is visually imaginative as well as meticulously characterized. It draws on the very real complicated dynamics of having half your friend group be exes. With Hari Nef and Gayle Rankin starring, and Molly Ringwald as a ubiquitous TedTalk badass, the film is a hallmark of classic horror with a gay spin. [Bad Things](https://www.shudder.com/movies/watch/bad-things/9275aca0731c9cb5) is streaming. Erica Tremblay As one of the voices behind FXâ€™s Reservation Dogs, Erica Tremblay demonstrates an acute ability for coming of age narratives. Although her previous work was mostly in [documentaries](https://www.vice.com/en/article/7bmwa9/in-the-turn-takes-us-inside-the-world-of-queer-roller-derby), Tremblayâ€™s storytelling has always been deeply intimate, with traces of her own life as a queer Native woman. Her first feature Fancy Dance, starring Academy Award Nominee Lily Gladstone, feels like a holistic culmination of all her previous work. The film is at once a family drama, a road film, and a murder mystery â€” yet never feels overstretched or cluttered. After a stunning premiere at Sundance in 2023 and almost a year in limbo, Apple has finally acquired the distribution rights. [Fancy Dance](https://www.apple.com/tv-pr/news/2024/02/apple-original-films-lands-critically-acclaimed-feature-fancy-dance-starring-academy-award-nominee-lily-gladstone-and-hailing-from-director-and-co-writer-erica-tremblay/) is coming to theaters and streaming in 2024. Jane Schoenbrun A writer and critic at [Filmmaker](https://filmmakermagazine.com/author/danschoenbrun/) magazine first, Jane Schoenbrunâ€™s progression into directing felt inevitable. Their directorial debut was a documentary about Slender Man called A Self Induced Hallucination. Their first narrative feature, Weâ€™re All Going to the Worldâ€™s Fair explores internet aesthetics and trans perspectives. An eerie homage to low budget horror, it premiered at Sundance in 2021 before landing on HBO Max. Their next feature, I Saw the TV Glow, stars Justice Smith and Bridegt Lundy-Paine as a pair of teenagers whose grasp on reality loosens after their favorite show mysteriously gets canceled. After its Sundance Premiere earlier this year, it is set to have an international premiere at the 2024 Berlin International Film Festival. [Weâ€™re All Going to the Worldâ€™s Fair](https://www.wereallgoingtotheworldsfair.com/) is streaming. I Saw The TV Glow will be distributed by A24 in 2024. Isabel Sandoval Filipina actress and director Isabel Sandovalâ€™s films are both thematically universal and intimately personal; featuring themes of love and identity. With her 2019 feature, Lingua Franca, she became the first out trans woman of color to [compete](https://variety.com/2020/film/spotlight/isabel-sandoval-lingua-franca-1234749951/) at the Venice Film Festival. It received a nomination for the John Cassavetes Award at the Independent Spirit Awards. In the film, Sandoval stars as a caregiver who falls in love with her patientâ€™s grandson. The film is distinctive, and emotionally complex with melancholy built into its world. Her presence on screen is so haunting, itâ€™s a wonder she was working both sides of the camera. [Lingua Franca](https://www.criterionchannel.com/videos/lingua-franca) is streaming.

author: NBC New York Staff
title: Health warning: FDA issues oysters, clams advisory for Norovirus â€“ NBC10 Philadelphia
text:
Recalls Health warning: FDA issues oysters, clams advisory for Norovirus Two separate 'safety alerts' are warning restaurants and consumers about possible contamination By NBC New York Staff â€¢ Published December 19, 2024 â€¢ Updated 50 mins ago NBCUniversal Media, LLC The FDA is issuing multiple advisories for oysters and Manila clams that could be contaminated with Norovirus, a serious gastrointestinal illness.
In the case of oysters from British Columbia first recalled in California, a notice says the product should not be consumed or distributed and should be marked as "not safe" and "don't touch."
> Philadelphia news 24/7: Watch NBC10 free wherever you are
"Consumers should not eat these potentially contaminated oysters. Consumers who have symptoms should contact their health care provider to report their symptoms and receive care," the FDA said.
British Columbia oysters recall Get top local stories in Philly delivered to you every morning. >Sign up for NBC Philadelphia's News Headlines newsletter. A recall was issued by S&M Shellfish Co in San Francisco, California, on Dec. 13 for shellstock sold as Fanny Bay, Buckley Bay and Royal Miyagi Oysters after multiple confirmed Norovirus illnesses were reported, according to the state.
The California recall says the concerned product was harvested in British Columbia from Dec. 1 to Dec. 9 by Pacific Northwest Shellfish and Union Bay Seafood. The affected certificate numbers are BC 740 SP and BC 6001 SP.
The "Urgent Product Recall" said any product that meets the recall criteria should be "IMMEDIATELY STOPPED" from consumption or distribution and should be returned or labeled "NOT SAFE, DONâ€™T TOUCH and/or to be DESTROYED."
U.S. & World Stories that affect your life across the U.S. and around the world.
Immigration 7 mins ago Immigration agency deports highest numbers since 2014, aided by more flights Florida 26 mins ago Florida police issue warning after monkeys are spotted roaming residential community The FDA issued an advisory for these oysters on Dec. 18 to restaurants and food retailers in Arizona, California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Kentucky, Missouri, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina and Pennsylvania. The FDA said affected product may have been shipped to those states.
SAFETY ALERT: FDA advises restaurants & retailers not to serve or sell & consumers not to eat certain oysters fr British Columbia, Canada, potentially contaminated w/ #norovirus . Distributed to: AZ, CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, HI, IL, KY, MO, NC, NV, NJ, NY, & PA https://t.co/XyjJRERHf2
â€” U.S. FDA Human Foods Program (@FDAfood) December 18, 2024 Washington state oysters and Manila clams advisory A second issue first was flagged by Washington State which started a recall of shellstock on Dec. 12. The product was initially reported as being shipped within Washington and to California.
The oysters and Manila clams in question were harvested from Nov. 15 to Dec. 11 by Rudy's Shellfish from the Pickering Passage growing area of Washington state, according to the FDA . Consumers and businesses are advised to look at the packing label for information on the harvest date and location matching these details.
The FDA says the affected food may have been sent to restaurants and food stores in Arizona, California, Florida, Massachusetts, Michigan, New York and Washington state.
"The FDA is awaiting further information on distribution of these oysters and Manila clams and will continue to monitor the investigation and provide assistance to state authorities as needed," the FDA said.
The U.S. FDA is advising restaurants and retailers to not serve or sell and for consumers not to eat certain #oysters and Manila #clams from Pickering Passage, Washington potentially contaminated with #Norovirus .
Sold in AZ, CA, FL, MA, MI, NY, and WA. https://t.co/wEnGvercCA pic.twitter.com/ftTyoj3hTD
â€” U.S. FDA Human Foods Program (@FDAfood) December 16, 2024 "Restaurants and retailers should not serve or sell these potentially contaminated oysters and Manila clams. Restaurants and retailers should dispose of any products by throwing them in the garbage or returning them to their distributor for destruction," the FDA said.
The FDA said food containing norovirus contamination could look, smell and taste normal.
Anyone experiencing norovirus symptoms, including diarrhea, abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting or fever after eating affected oysters, should contact a medical professional, the FDA advises.

author: Josh Evanoff
title: Rico Verhoeven reveals talks are ongoing for fight against Francis Ngannou: "Let's say we're halfway there" | BJPenn.com
text:
Rico Verhoeven reveals talks are ongoing for fight against Francis Ngannou: â€œLetâ€™s say weâ€™re halfway thereâ€
Josh Evanoff- March 19, 2025
GLORY Kickboxing star Rico Verhoeven has revealed talks are ongoing for a fight against PFL champion Francis Ngannou.
â€˜The Predatorâ€™ hasnâ€™t been seen in the cage since a clash against Renan Ferreira in the PFL cage last October. Fighting for the first time since his destructive knockout loss to Anthony Joshua in March, Francis Ngannou handed â€˜Problemaâ€™ a first-round stoppage loss. The bout was his first time stepping into the cage since his win over Ciryl Gane in January 2022, his final UFC appearance.
As of now, Francis Ngannou is expected to compete in the boxing ring next. The PFL Superfights heavyweight champion has publicly discussed bouts against the likes of Deontay Wilder and Wladimir Klitschko next, with â€˜The Bronze Bomberâ€™ having already approved the matchup. However, it appears Ngannou could easily find himself in a fight against Glory Kickboxing champion Rico Verhoeven next instead.
â€˜The King of Kickboxingâ€™ hasnâ€™t been seen since a unanimous decision victory over Levi Rigters last December at GLORY Collision 7. Appearing on The Ariel Helwani Show earlier today, Rico Verhoeven discussed a potential fight against Francis Ngannou. For what itâ€™s worth, both men have welcomed the matchup in the past, and today was no exception. In the discussion with Helwani, the kickboxer welcomed a bout with Ngannou.
RELATED: DONN DAVIS DISMISSES RUMORS OF FRANCIS NGANNOU LEAVING THE PFL: â€œFAKE NEWS!â€
Rico Verhoeven is optimistic about a potential fight with Francis Ngannou ðŸ‘€
â€œItâ€™s 100% on the radar. I recently saw an interview with Francis that itâ€™s also on his radarâ€¦ There are a lot of talks going on, and Iâ€™m excited for itâ€¦ Letâ€™s say weâ€™re halfway. Iâ€™m always veryâ€¦
[pic.twitter.com/YSjY5iqBHy]â€” Ariel Helwani (@arielhelwani)
[March 19, 2025]
GLORY Kickboxingâ€™s Rico Verhoeven teases fight against PFL champion Francis Ngannou
However, it appears that the fight has moved beyond internet chatter. Speaking with Ariel Helwani, Rico Verhoeven revealed that talks with Francis Ngannou are ongoing, with several promotions. While â€˜The Kick of Kickboxingâ€™ didnâ€™t specify what ruleset a possible bout with â€˜The Predatorâ€™ would be under, he appears down for anything.
â€œYeah, most definitely [that fight] is 100% on the radar.â€ Rico Verhoeven responded to Ariel Helwani when asked about a fight with Francis Ngannou. â€œI recently saw an interview with Francis that said it was also on his radar and that heâ€™s interested in that fight. So, yeah thereâ€™s a lot of talks going on and Iâ€™m excited for it. Itâ€™s a huge challenge and itâ€™s something new, itâ€™s something different, something we havenâ€™t seen beforeâ€¦â€
He continued, â€œWeâ€™re in talks with different organizations, different martial set, and different people who have shown interest in a fight like this. So, letâ€™s say weâ€™re halfway [there]. Iâ€™m always very positive, so letâ€™s say weâ€™re halfwayâ€¦ Iâ€™m interested. Francis is interested. Now letâ€™s see who the promoter is going to be.â€
What do you make of these comments from the Glory Kickboxing champion? Do you want to see Francis Ngannou vs. Rico Verhoeven?
This article appeared first on BJPENN.COM
